You're right about the fact that I'm angry. I'm a disabled veteran who is usually teetering on thoughts of being just another one of the 22 of us a day who can't take this shit anymore. I've sat back and watched my fellow citizens be spit on, beaten and constantly threatened by groups of people burning our flag in OUR streets, while they wave foreign flags high. I've saw the silliness that is political correctness infect my country like a plague. With people using it as a weapon against any who oppose them. I've seen our rights eroded. Our politicians on the take, becoming so brazenly corrupted they don't even respect you enough to hide it anymore. The world is at war and the fools dance ignorantly to slaughter.

I guess it depends on ones interpretation of common sense. in my estimation, common sense would require sufficient specific information of particular relevance as a foundation for the formulation of an opinion or belief. there are many types of proceedings which are best performed in circumstances where those involved and the subject matter remain confidential until certain resolutions are established, jury deliberations for example. this doesn't necessarily indicate that the proceedings are not in the peoples best interest. perhaps we should consider whether there are good reasons, that we are not aware of or do not comprehend as yet, (as we may not be experienced trade negotiators) that might require that initial negotiations remain confidential.
